definition: a much-travelled person, well acquainted with the ways of the world

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

sentences.english: Chen Jiaying is Laojiang Hu that she would take hasty to Faye Wong in the stomach joke?
sentences.chinese: 陳家瑛是老江湖，她會草率到拿王菲的肚子開玩笑嗎？

sentences.english: LaoJiangHu ghost uncle, is before the sword, is now home TiTouJiang descends to the porter.
sentences.chinese: 老江湖鬼叔，以前是刀家的門房，現已淪落爲剃頭匠。

definition: experienced person/an old hand at sth
rigorous schemes and deep foresight (idiom); astute and circumspect
sophisticate/man with extensive experience/child prodigy/Wunderkind (i.e. brilliant child)/spirit within a person (i.e. blood and essential breath 血氣|血气 of TCM)
lit. veteran of a hundred battles (idiom)/fig. experienced/seasoned
variant of 老奸巨猾[lao3 jian1 ju4 hua2]
experienced in the ways of the world (idiom); worldly-wise/sophisticated
newly hatched bird/fig. inexperienced person/fig. chick (slighting term for young woman)/bimbo
